summary: The "MORE Nurses Act" (H.R. 3333) mandates the National Advisory Council on Nurse Education and Practice to investigate the nursing shortage in the United States. The Council will examine workforce capacity, identify contributing factors, and assess the impact of federal policies. The Council must submit a report with findings, conclusions, and recommendations to the President, Congress, and the Secretary of Health and Human Services within a year of the Act's enactment. The report will be made available to the public.
